job_description:
Overview:

The purpose of the role is to create availability and sustainability of the total plant (buildings, machinery and utilities) by leading a team to execute the lean maintenance strategy and sustainability strategy towards safe delivery.
You will work Monday - Friday, no shift work required.
Responsibilities:

Improve plant preventative maintenance to reduce planned downtime and corrective maintenance:
Lead the team effort at information flow to prepare daily QCDM in a minimum time window
Lead the team to grow of the quantity and quality of the preventative mainteinance planning
Coach the growth and training program of predictive maintenance program
Improve the team knowledge by driving quantity and quality of the training program
Coach the team to a high maintenance planning achievement
Coach the team to uptimize the team technicians utalisation booked.
Improve plant reliability to reduce unplanned downtime, to reduce maintenance budget and reduce technical stock inventory by:
Coach team improvement of problem solving to root cause by act preventative at safe delivery priorities
Coach team project management at maintenance and sustainability performance gaps
Maintain and provide input for maintenance AOP
Propose and execute maintenance budgets
Optimization of maintenance program and participating in key site projects
Improve plant sustainability by
Coach the team to execute ReCon projects
Reporting and communication of all sustainability information and KPI’s in and outside the plant
Responsible for utilities, water treatment and waste budget including AOP/IGP Process
Responsible for targets on water, gas and electricity
Project owner of sustainability investment projects including drafting URS and CAPEXes
Give input on sustainability for all investment projects
Initiating new sustainability projects
Improve plant corrective maintenance to a minimum unplanned downtime of process and packaging by:
Drive lean in the daily team maintenance meeting to set daily safe delivery priorities and give corrective and RCA owners
Drive lean in all team communications
Drive team information flow with and support to operations
Other:
Managing assets (updating ERP system in acquisition of new assets)
Reduce plant slow running by
Coach team project management at operational performance gaps
SAFETY: Drive plant safety injuries to a minimum by:
Change team safety culture to zero risk taking
Drive team to provide weekly near misses
Drive the team to execute daily STOP observations
Drive team Lock out Tag out execution
Drive team permits execution and auditation to a green kpi score
Drive team execution of the HSE duty holding ship to 100%
Qualifications:
Previous experience in a leadership role in a Production Area (preferably in FMCG) would be a plus
People management experience (preferred)
Excellent communications and interpersonal skills
Good analytical skills
A good linguistic competence of the Dutch and English language
Proven track record with continuous improvement processes and lean manufacturing
About PepsiCo
PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated more than $79 billion in net revenue in 2021, driven by a complementary beverage and convenient foods portfolio that includes Lay’s, Doritos, Cheetos, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Mountain Dew, Quaker, and SodaStream. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including many iconic brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales.
Guiding PepsiCo is our vision to Be the Global Leader in Beverages and Convenient Foods by Winning with PepsiCo Positive (pep+). pep+ is our strategic end-to-end transformation that puts sustainability and human capital at the center of how we will create value and growth by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for planet and people. For more information, visit www.pepsico.com.
Building a more sustainable food system is critical for the health of our communities and the planet we all share. Take a look at the latest efforts by PepsiCo to fight climate change, protect natural resources, and more: https://pepsico.com/sustainability/strategy
Why PepsiCo The Netherlands?
PepsiCo The Netherlands currently employs around 630 people at its 4 sites, including our headquarters in Utrecht and three production sites in Rotterdam, Zaandam and Broek op Langedijk. With well-known strong brands such as Pepsi, Lay’s, Tropicana, Quaker and Duyvis, we are in the Top 6 of food companies in The Netherlands. We pride ourselves on being a great place to work and were rewarded for the 10th time with the Top Employer certification The Netherlands and Europe. Joining PepsiCo means joining a dedicated team where innovation and forward thinking are encouraged.
We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity and inclusivity at our company; it is an essential part of our success. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, pregnancy or maternity, marital/civil partnerships, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation, gender or gender reassignment, disability or race including; color, nationality, ethnic or national origin. Please also visit www.pepsico.com/about/diversity-and-engagement for more information on what we do in practice to embrace diversity and inclusivity in the working surroundings and in society.

Overview:

HSE Officer is makings sure our people, temporary workers, contractors and the environment are kept safe. The HSE officer is responsible for HSE compliance of the plant. HSE Officer pro-actively picks up HSE related issues, proposes improvements and follows up on the implemention of these. Next to that acts as a role model for HSE behavior, supports and inspires colleagues in HSE related matters. Overall responsible for the HSE budget and timely submission and execution of the capital agenda.
Responsibilities:
Legal compliance on HSE (making decisions)
Owning HSE budget
Own the H&S KPI set and responsible to achieve it using QCDM-LEAN tools (executing)
Actively promote safe behaviour and address unsafe behaviour of Zaandam employees; display role model behaviour towards all employees on HSE (consultation and executing)
Administrator of the HSE part of the site QHSE system: develop, control, communicate about and continuously improve HSE procedures (executing)
Facilitating GEHSMS (safety management systems) section holders in developing their GEHSMS section according to sites GEHSMS AOP target (consultation)
Incident investigation and analysing PI HiPo reports, propose preventive actions and follow these up
Advise on HSE related aspects in capital projects (execution and consultation)
Follow all applicable rules and procedures regarding safety (execution)
Manage all environmental permits and first contact for legal authorities (execution)

Qualifications:
BSC/HBO/MBO qualification
Min. 3 years of experience
NEBOSH qualification, preferably HVK or MVK (or willigness to complete the course)
Knowledge of HSE management systems (ISO14001 – OHSAS18001)
Analytical, creative and innovative skills
A good linguistic competence of the Dutch and English language
Pro-active, accurate and act with positive criticism
Knowledge of a Behaviour Based Safety program is a plus
Productive communicator, tolerant with people and processes and wait for others to catch up before acting
At ease working in teams and independent
Familiar with continuous improvement processes and lean manufacturing
About PepsiCo
PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated more than $79 billion in net revenue in 2021, driven by a complementary beverage and convenient foods portfolio that includes Lay’s, Doritos, Cheetos, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Mountain Dew, Quaker, and SodaStream. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including many iconic brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales.
Guiding PepsiCo is our vision to Be the Global Leader in Beverages and Convenient Foods by Winning with PepsiCo Positive (pep+). pep+ is our strategic end-to-end transformation that puts sustainability and human capital at the center of how we will create value and growth by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for planet and people. For more information, visit www.pepsico.com.
Building a more sustainable food system is critical for the health of our communities and the planet we all share. Take a look at the latest efforts by PepsiCo to fight climate change, protect natural resources, and more: https://pepsico.com/sustainability/strategy
Why PepsiCo The Netherlands?
PepsiCo The Netherlands currently employs around 630 people at its 4 sites, including our headquarters in Utrecht and three production sites in Rotterdam, Zaandam and Broek op Langedijk. With well-known strong brands such as Pepsi, Lay’s, Quaker and Duyvis, we are in the Top 6 of food companies in The Netherlands. We pride ourselves on being a great place to work and were rewarded for the 10th time with the Top Employer certification The Netherlands and Europe. Joining PepsiCo means joining a dedicated team where innovation and forward thinking are encouraged.
We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity and inclusivity at our company; it is an essential part of our success. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, pregnancy or maternity, marital/civil partnerships, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation, gender or gender reassignment, disability or race including; color, nationality, ethnic or national origin. Please also visit www.pepsico.com/about/diversity-and-engagement for more information on what we do in practice to embrace diversity and inclusivity in the working surroundings and in society.

job_titles: Sr Manager Global Procurement Sustainability & Innovation – Packaging Sustainability
job_description:
General information
All posting locations: Amsterdam, , Netherlands
Job Function: 02 - Procurement
Date Published: 17-Jan-2023
Ref #: R-65488
Description & Requirements
Position Title: Sr Manager Global Procurement Sustainability & Innovation – Packaging Sustainability
Location: Amsterdam- NL
Job Description

Procurement and sustainability professional who excels in program management- senior stakeholder management- and problem-solving skills responsible for developing- implementing- and managing the Packaging Sustainability program as part of the Global Procurement Sustainability Program. You should have strong functional knowledge- a proven ability to drive results- and a passion for embedding sustainability in core business processes.
In this role- you are the Procurement Owner of the Global Sustainable Packaging Program. You lead this pillar in support of Kraft Heinz ESG Strategy objectives as they relate to procurement and are responsible for developing and delivering a roadmap which strengthens our supplier innovation pipeline and delivers a competitive advantage.
You will coordinate with and enable relevant teams in the delivery of ESG commitments and will be responsible to adapt the program to fit evolving priorities within the Kraft Heinz ESG Strategy. In addition- you will support the broader Global Procurement Sustainability Program activities by contributing to continuous improvement in positive procurement- value creation- internal and external engagement- innovation- supplier collaboration- third party partnerships- and internal collaboration.

Core Responsibilities
You are the Global Procurement Owner of the Sustainable Packaging Program:
Manage a structured multi-stakeholder program- leading relevant rituals and routines.
Establish a comprehensive program plan and make recommendations which support overall value creation and delivery of the Kraft Heinz ESG strategy.
Be responsible to the Procurement Sustainability Program owner for program alignment and delivery of key milestones and initiatives.
Enable Category Leads to drive initiatives within their categories which advance the Kraft Heinz ESG Objectives.
Coordinate and across teams in the delivery of relevant ESG commitments and objectives.
Collaborate cross-functionally to advance supplier collaboration ways of working to drive ESG collaboration.
Act as a strategic partner to the Research & Development and ESG function regarding the development of strategic workstreams:
Packaging end of life (Recyclable- Reusable- Compostable)
Sustainable Packaging Raw Materials (Recycled or Eco-Friendly alternatives)
Innovating New Sustainability Conscious Product Packaging
Recycling Infrastructure Development
Seek continuous improvement regarding Procurement’s role in Packaging Sustainability: looking for process- product and service improvement opportunities.
Project manage the implementation of any agreed strategies- contracts or processes for targeted ESG projects.
Deliver results- taking responsibility for change management relating to the ESG strategy. Engage and collaborate with external stakeholders (suppliers- service providers- NGOs- etc.) in advancement of the Packaging Sustainability Program.
Represent Procurement in the Sustainable Packaging space with internal and external stakeholders – while seeking ways to bring outside insights and learnings into the function.
Support the Global Procurement Sustainability Program:
Collaborate with the Procurement Sustainability program owner to help drive a continuous improvement approach across the broader Procurement Sustainability Program.
Collaborate with other core pillar owners to increase the effectiveness and quality of the overall Procurement Sustainability Program.
Support effective ESG messaging and reporting for external and internal communications (ESG Report- Dow Jones Sustainability- CDP- media queries- etc.).
Contribute to the Procurement transformation as part of the Procurement Excellence Team.
Qualifications
Education: Master’s degree by education and/or experience
Work Experience: 5+ years of experience in relevant program management roles- innovation and co-creation roles involving cross-functional senior stakeholder management- or strategy/sustainability/innovation consulting roles. Must have a good professional understanding of the following:
Strong knowledge of FMCG and procurement corporate sustainability- and understanding of related processes- tools and competences-
Program and project management best practices; and
Large international experience- working with and in different cultures.
Professional Knowledge: Familiarity with ESG reporting to capital markets and 3rd parties- NGO landscape- global legislative landscape- competition landscape- industry trends- and consumer/industry trends in Packaging:
Food Service single use sachets
Recycled content alternatives
Packaging Quality Guidelines
Recycling infrastructure development
Relevant Legislation
Supplier Collaboration & Relationship Management
Innovation Best Practices
Value Exchange Contracting
Professional Profile:
Ability to effectively develop initiatives which contribute to delivering against the company and procurement strategy.
Exceptional written and verbal communication and listening skills.
Exceptional stakeholder management skills.
Ability to deliver high quality finished products with autonomy.
Results and solution orientated with a strong personal drive.
Organizational Agility – knows how to get things done both through formal and informal channels.
Effective at establishing trust and building effective business relationships and getting things done through others.
Strong deduction abilities and problem-solving skills.
Can effectively articulate various perspectives and impacts of issues and project them into the future. Able to see all sides and the inherent value to stakeholders.
Linguistic Abilities: You work in a multinational team in which English is the business language. Other languages are a bonus.
Approach to Business: As the Procurement leader of the Global Sustainable Packaging Program you will be required to interact with a variety of stakeholders across all time zones. As such- a flexible approach to working hours- in addition to the following- will be key to your success:
Flexible to travel.
Effective at setting priorities and dedicating time for what is most important.
Pragmatic approach to setbacks.
In light of the ongoing procurement evolution- the scope of this job description remains flexible to changes subject to business priorities.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race- religion- color- national origin- sex- gender- gender expression- sexual orientation- age- marital status- veteran status- or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process- to perform essential job functions- and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day.
As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.
Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes.
